content.text:
A while back, I decided to start collecting sigmoids. I defined a sigmoid as a function that interpolates smoothly from one value to another as x varies, and to no one's surprise, there are a lot of different functions that satisfy that requirement. So in the end, I also decided that no two functions were allowed to be equivalent - so, no scaling and translating should be able to get the graphs to completely overlap. This is still a sizeable collection, so I decided to feature it here. All functions have been transformed to interpolate from 0 to 1 in a somewhat similar fashion.

Link: [Sigmoids](https://www.desmos.com/calculator/1c10e1dd8c)

Yes, *technically* one of them only counts as a sigmoid as m approaches infinity, but I decided to count it anyway.
